programme.desc: Return to the Wild. Six graduates from jungle school are finally set to be freed into the wild from the pre-release islands after an arduous journey by road and river into the heart of Borneo.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School II (1)
programme.desc: The Domino Effect. Big changes are afoot for some of the pupils at Orangutan Jungle School, where orphaned orangutans learn the forest skills they need to survive in the wild; four new arrivals join the nursery classes and some familiar faces move up a grade.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School II (2)
programme.desc: Dilla's Surprise. Recent nursery graduates Jelapat, Talaken, Bawan and Rona join their classmates at their new classroom; Dilla unexpectedly gives birth at midnight, but the delivery does not go smoothly.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School II (3)
programme.desc: Kesi Turns a Corner. Beni and Lala are confined to the clinic following an accident; bullied Kesi causes concern for the team; Clara and her daughter, Clarita, are chosen for release back into the wild.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School II
programme.desc: Bears on the Move. Young orangutans who have lost their mothers to poaching and deforestation learn the skills they'll need to survive in the wild at a unique forest school.

programme.title: Secrets of the Enchanted Forests (2)
programme.sub-title: Seasonal. Looking at the clever ways flora and fauna navigate seasonal changes together.
programme.desc: Seasonal. Looking at the clever ways flora and fauna navigate seasonal changes together.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (1)
programme.desc: Madagascar. Madagascar is home to strange animals not found anywhere else on Earth; when these animals fight for supremacy, their battles are just as strange, from weird neck-wrestling weevils to ring tailed lemur moms that go into battle with baby on board.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas (2)
programme.desc: Australia. Australia is home to an eclectic array of creatures, and the ways to succeed as an alpha are just as diverse; the beach turns into a dueling ground and the outback becomes a boxing ring, as animals face off with their own kind.

programme.title: Kalahari: Land of Secret Alliances (2)
programme.desc: Thirst for rain alongside the animals of the Kalahari as elephant herds cooperate, and meerkat's adopt a strange babysitter in the depths of a brutally dry year.

programme.title: Kalahari: Land of Secret Alliances (3)
programme.desc: Behind the Lens. Track scientists arrive in the Kalahari to test the hypothesis that animal collaboration is the key to the dizzying diversity of the region's species; they monitor behavior, decipher data, and deliver conclusions.

programme.title: Alien Abyss (1)
programme.desc: Origin Stories. Getting acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learning how billions of years' worth of changes have shaped their looks and skills; meeting blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs and much more.

programme.title: Wild Fighters (4)
programme.desc: The Struggle for Love. The love rivalry shakes every fiber of the body as hormones invade the blood, and some of the most overwhelming spectacles on the planet are produced; the language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most diverse behaviors.

programme.title: Baby Chimp Rescue (3)
programme.desc: A New Beginning. Jimmy and Jenny Desmond and their team are at breaking point, with 38 chimps to look after; losing one of them to illness leaves the team more determined than ever to build them all a new sanctuary where they can live like wild chimps.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains (4)
programme.desc: The Inside Story. Meeting the innovative teams working to preserve and protect Kenya's wildlife; Save the Elephants' radio-tracking-collar system; a drone that monitors wild dog packs; a local team of Maasai cheetah trackers.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild II (7)
programme.desc: Maldives: Paradise Shrinking. Rising sea levels threaten the small island nation of the Maldives.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild III (1)
programme.sub-title: Costa Rica - Shark Defenders. Sharks are at risk in Costa Rica.
programme.desc: Costa Rica - Shark Defenders. Sharks are at risk in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife V (7)
programme.desc: Give and Take. Hope Swinimer rescues, rehabilitates and releases thousands of animals each year.

programme.title: Hubble's Canvas
programme.sub-title: Vanishing Points. Hubble's Canvas reveals the masterpieces that abound in the universe.
programme.desc: Vanishing Points. Hubble's Canvas reveals the masterpieces that abound in the universe.

programme.title: A Park for All Seasons (1)
programme.desc: Grasslands. The Grasslands National Park protects the North American mixed grass prairie.

programme.title: World's Most Scenic River Journeys II (7)
programme.desc: Buller River. Tackling the grade 6 rapids and untamed waters of the Buller River on the west coast of New Zealand's South Island, blessed by a Māori elder of the Ngāti Apa ki te Rā Tō.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild III (4)
programme.sub-title: How Smart are Sharks? Sharks may be much more intelligent than previously thought.
programme.desc: How Smart are Sharks? Sharks may be much more intelligent than previously thought.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas V (4)
programme.sub-title: Eclipses. Lunar and solar eclipses.
programme.desc: Eclipses. Lunar and solar eclipses.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas V (3)
programme.sub-title: What Stars Are Made of. An exploration of the astrophysics of stars creating matter.
programme.desc: What Stars Are Made of. An exploration of the astrophysics of stars creating matter.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries (10)
programme.desc: Critical Plains. Discover how staff treat a wounded eland and reunite a hartebeest with her herd.

programme.title: Ol Pejeta Diaries (5)
programme.desc: Return of the Africa Titans. Two wild black rhinos fight to the death; a new ambassador for the black rhinos.

programme.title: Hope for Wildlife V (3)
programme.desc: A Very Precious Thing. Two tiny orphans struggle to survive; Hope takes a second swing at a release gone wrong.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School (1)
programme.desc: And So it Begins. An introduction to some of the big characters including "class clown" Valentino and "Big Boy" Beni; an emergency arrival of teenage mom Clara and her baby Clarita; vets round up the older orangutans, who are now ready to be released.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School (2)
programme.desc: Movin' On Up. "Class Clown" Valentino is busy showing off; the staff decide that "Big Boy" Beni needs to lose weight; teenage mom Clara and her baby Clarita face a return to island life; they welcome a new pupil: Alba, the only reported albino orangutan.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School (3)
programme.desc: King Kasper. Kasper, who is 90kgs, somehow eludes the capture team and climbs 30 meters high in a tree; Beni's food theft and ongoing weight gain starts causing serious concern for his health.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School (4)
programme.desc: The Misfits. Valentino, Yutris and the rest of group two have fun as they visit group three's flooded classroom; three quarantine infants get the results of their TB tests; the residents of Bangamat Island do not welcome newcomers leading to a confrontation.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School (5)
programme.desc: A Whole New World. Moving day arrives for the nursery school kids; Beni gets a beating from a bully; the socialization cage has a new queen; dominant male Pujon is still on a time-out after attacking Alba, but he's allowed a second chance to bond with his rival.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School (6)
programme.desc: Weighs and Means. Beni faces a day of reckoning as all the forest school students are held back for a weigh-in; Alba is back in isolation after being diagnosed with typhoid.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School (7)
programme.desc: Handle With Care. Rescued orphan Josh needs his broken wrist examined by the school vets, while Beni has a trip to the dentist to treat his bad breath.

programme.title: Wild Fighters (4)
programme.desc: The Struggle for Love. The love rivalry shakes every fiber of the body as hormones invade the blood, and some of the most overwhelming spectacles on the planet are produced; the language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most diverse behaviors.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Cat-Sitting. After a head-on collision with the milkman, Mr. Bean’s landlady is rushed to hospital, leaving him to look after her odious one-eyed cat Scrapper. Fur isn’t the only thing that flies and in the end it’s Bean that needs looking after.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Bottle. Mr. Bean is delighted with his new ‘ship in a bottle’ until it mistakenly ends up on a milkman’s float. He frantically pursues his prize possession, only to see it disappear into a milk bottling plant at the local dairy. Getting it back promises to be a mission of the impossible.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Goldfish. With his teddy bear at the dry cleaners, Mr. Bean finds himself feeling lonely. Fortunately, a new playmate appears in the shape of a goldfish from the garden pond. Bean has a great time with his new best friend until, at the seaside, he discovers that some fish are gigantic, have large pointed teeth and fins on their backs.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Inventor. When Mr. Wicket gets a new lodger who is an Inventor, and a big nuisance, Bean discovers that he has to become ‘inventive’ himself. But, when your enemy is clever and sneaky, you have to be even cleverer and sneakier. Bean has never lost ‘a cleverness competition’, but maybe there is a first time for everything!

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes
programme.sub-title: School Daze
programme.desc: Baby Looney Tunes introduces the world's most beloved cartoon characters as precocious preschoolers, discovering the world one baby-step at a time!

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Analog Ella. Ella and the gang are going camping! But as they approach their camp site, Maggie alerts them that a giant solar flare is heading their way. They must turn off all their electronics until the storm subsides.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: In the year 3021, on a space station somewhere between Mars and Jupiter in the Milky Way, 8-year-old Ella Ryder sets out with her friends on exciting adventures of discovery.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Haunted Mouse. Tuffy hires detectives Tom and Jerry to investigate the ghost hauntings in his house. At first Tom and Jerry think it's just his imagination but discover that the house seems haunted. They find out it's a rat who wanted to chase Tuffy out so he could live there with his family but is ok with sharing the home.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom-Foolery. Butch tricks Tom into switching places with him and sends Tom off to live the life of a street cat. Butch finds out that living Tom's cushy life isn't what it seems when Jerry makes his life difficult and Ginger's doting is humiliating. Tom finds that living off the street is tricky and difficult. They very quickly switch back to the way it was.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show II
programme.desc: Tough Luck Duck. Little Quaker fears his luck will turn for the worse when he inadvertently walks under a ladder. When a series of unfortunate and painful incidents happen to Tom, Jerry and Spike, but not Little Quaker, he thinks he is to blame.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Superfied. Dr. Bigby creates cookies that can give animals superpowers. Jerry and Napoleon sneak some cookies and they have fun terrorizing Tom an alley cat who has broken in to eat them. The tables are turned when Tom gets his hands on the cookies.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Double Trouble. Mr. Bean is over the moon when he meets Mr. Pod because both men have so much in common; same shirt, jacket, trousers and underpants. And to top it all, Pod is Bean’s spitting image! Bean falls to Earth with a bump, though, when his girlfriend, Irma Gobb, finds Mr. Pod much better looking than him.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Home Movie. Mr Bean is unimpressed with a horror movie he sees at the cinema and reckons he can do much better. Bean sets out to create his very own home movie masterpiece –featuring Mrs Wicket Irma and Teddy! The screening in the garden is a huge success but will Mrs Wicket be pleased with her makeover and starring role?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Fish Sitting. Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s pet goldfish while she is away. With a ravenous Scrapper sniffing around Bean ends up becoming more bodyguard than babysitter. But when he manages to lose his fishy friend Mr Bean takes a nightmare journey down the sewer and back to his neighbour’s house via the park. Can Mr Bean get the pesky pet back in the bowl before Mrs Wicket returns home?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: The Cruise. Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. Once aboard the huge ocean liner Mr Bean soon settles into a life of luxury but while showing off to a new friend Bean becomes ‘man overboard’ and stranded on a dessert island. The hungrier he gets the wilder he becomes and desperate to find a way off the island.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Litterbug. Mr Bean is furious with the untidy state of the streets and all the people who drop litter so he goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town. Armed with several bin bags Mr Bean collects all the rubbish and puts up his own ‘No Littering’ signs - which have absolutely no effect. When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Rat Trap. Mr Bean is very scared on a stormy night and even more so when he hears Mrs Wicket screaming from downstairs. Mr Bean investigates and finds the source of the problem...a rat! Mr Bean offers to help Mrs Wicket rid their house of the troublesome rodent. The only problem is the crafty rat is going nowhere fast and is always one step ahead. Mr Bean looks to inspiration from the Pied Piper but fairy stories don’t always have happy endings.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Valentine's Bean. Mr Bean decides to do something romantic on Valentine’s Day for his long-suffering girlfriend Irma. But while he is secretly delivering her valentines card Mr Bean finds out he has a love rival for Irma’s attention. Bean steps up his efforts and takes Irma on a ‘date’ to the Valentine’s Fair only to find his love rival is there too! But will the fortune-teller’s prediction be the ticket to a happy ending?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: All You Can Eat. Mr Bean has forgotten he's supposed to be cooking dinner for his long-suffering girlfriend Irma. He dashes to the supermarket to buy some groceries but why buy food when you can win an entire trolley full in an All You Can Eat Competition? But Mr Bean has some stiff competition - no one can eat one of Mr Magg’s pies quicker than Mr Maggs himself. Mr Bean has to think fast to win. But after all that eating will Bean still be in the mood to cook a romantic meal?

Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Heel! What a disaster!: the Queen’s favorite booties have gone missing! And if Alice and Lewis don’t find them, they’re going to have to shine all fifty-thirteen other pairs of shoes in her majesty’s possession! Hot on the heels of the mischievous boots, our two heroes must use clever tactics to persuade them to get back to the Queen’s feet!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Too Young. When Alice and Lewis go to the Valley of the Night to look for MooMoo wool, they run into Queen and Charlie. When the little prince asks if he can go with the girl and her rabbit friend, the Queen begrudgingly agrees, and orders the two friends to take good care of her nephew. Charlie is ecstatic to be able to go on a “big boy’s adventure!” But is brought down to Earth with a bang when he finds out his aunt has been following them on the quiet. Feeling betrayed, he decides to run away.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Frost Ball. The King of Frostaland invites the Queen to a “frost ball” in his realm. Eager to look good, the Wonderland monarch appoints Lewis to open the ball, and threatens to remove him as clockmaster should he mess up! The poor rabbit must now set about learning the art of “tea-skating,” a kind of ice-skating on teapots! Only problem is, he’s scared of taking the plunge and decides to listen to Dodson’s advice (the dodo’s taken on the role of self-appointed coach) instead of simply trying it out himself. Needless to say, Dodson exploits the situation to get extra special treatment. So Alice steps in, determined to do whatever it takes to bring Lewis to his senses.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Sleeping King. When the Queen reluctantly takes Charlie to Frostaland so he can take part in the traditional “Cherry-Choc Harvest,” she finds the King fast asleep, due to a blunder committed by Alice. But instead of helping Alice and Lewis find an antidote to break the magic spell he’s under, the monarch throws every monkey wrench she can possibly get her hands on into the works! Truth is: she’s jealous of Charlie’s affection for the King of Frostaland.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Nurse! Envious of all the attention his landlady is receiving because of a broken leg, Mr. Bean decides to 'break' his leg too. When he ends up in hospital under the care of the Matron from Hell he discovers there are some kinds of attention even he doesn't enjoy.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Dead Cat. Whilst trying to redecorate the hall, Bean is obstructed at every turn by his landlady’s vile one-eyed cat. Bean pops it in the dustbin to keep it out of the way for a while. Just his luck that it’s rubbish collection day.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Supertrolley. Nipping to the shops for a few provisions becomes a nightmare when a mile-long shopping list from his landlady and a clapped out trolley with a wonky wheel conspire to ruin his day. Subscribing to the theory that bigger is better, he constructs his own shopping trolley incorporating a petrol mower, pram wheels and an extra pair of hydraulic hands.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Magpie. When nursing an injured magpie in his room, Mr. Bean learns something the rest of us already know: magpies can’t help stealing anything that sparkles. When the police arrive to investigate the theft of his landlady’s jewellery, it’s not just Mr. Bean that needs to take flight.

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes
programme.sub-title: Comfort Level. Sylvester learns to live without his blankey.
programme.desc: Baby Looney Tunes introduces the world's most beloved cartoon characters as precocious preschoolers, discovering the world one baby-step at a time!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Super Tilly. Tilly is dressed as her alter-ego, SuperTilly – the greatest superhero in the universe! When her dad asks her if she can send him his toolbox, it’s SuperTilly to the rescue!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: White Dwarf, Blue Madhu. When Glitch's compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Birds of a Feather. Ginger is in charge of taking care of her mother's bird. Tom tries his hardest to keep from eating the bird but can't control himself. He gets kicked out by Ginger and feels guilty. Tom and Jerry work together to keep the bird safe from Butch.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Vampire Mouse. Jerry pretends to be a vampire to scare Tom. Tom balances trying to keep vampire Jerry at bay and helping the witches make a new potion. Now it's up to Tom with the help of his friend Newt to defeat the vampire mouse before it's too late!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Entering and Breaking. When Rick leaves Spike in charge of protecting the house against burglars Spike steps up and trains Tom and Jerry to be his helpers. At first it seems like they are going to fumble their security jobs but then a burglar proves to be no match for our destructive trio.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show II
programme.desc: Squeaky Clean. Fed up with Tom's cat hair, Rick buys the "Suck-Up," a next level Roomba-like cleaner. The Suck-Up patrols the house and cleans nonstop. At first, Tom enjoys the little modern mechanical marvel using it to clean Jerry out of house and home! But when the self-programming machine turns on them both and takes over the house -- Tom and Jerry team up to defeat it.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Franken Kitty. Dr Bigby creates a machine to turn back the hands of time for his beloved cat Wilson. Tom is trying to break into the lab to eat Jerry and Napoleon and accidentally gets mistaken for a young Wilson and is taken home. Tom must convince Dr. Bigby he's got the wrong cat! Jerry and Napoleon are left with the real Wilson who is a mean vicious cat.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A Grand Invitation. Mr. Bean meets an aristocratic old lady when he nearly runs over her lapdog with his mini. He’s thrilled to be invited for luncheon at her grand but strangely shabby mansion. Bean is determined to rise to the occasion. He’s so busy with matters of protocol he doesn’t notice that the lady and her sinister butler aren’t quite what they seem…

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A Royal Make-over. How does one choose tasteful wallpaper these days? After watching a royal documentary on TV, Mr. Bean decides to decorate his room in the style of Buckingham Palace. If the Queen’s new wallpaper is good enough for Her Royal Highness, then it’s going to be good enough for him. Meanwhile, his landlady, Mrs. Wicket, suffers from illusions of grandeur and crowns herself Queen of the street.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: SuperMarrow. Mr. Bean finds himself in a race to grow a giant marrow with his next-door neighbour. There’s prize money at stake and a chance to get his photo in the papers. And so, as the competition gets tough, Bean’s gardening techniques become more ingenious, unconventional and desperate.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean in Love. He’s got her record, the poster and the T-shirt, so when Mr. Bean’s heart-throb, Roxy, is set to sing in concert at the London Palladium, he sets his sights on the only thing that will make his life complete: her signature in his autograph book. A difficult feat but can love prevail?

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Friends. The bugs talk about what it means to be someone's friend.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes
programme.sub-title: Let Them Make Cake
programme.desc: Baby Looney Tunes introduces the world's most beloved cartoon characters as precocious preschoolers, discovering the world one baby-step at a time!

programme.sub-title: Mind Your Manners

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Analog Ella. Ella and the gang are going camping! But as they approach their camp site, Maggie alerts them that a giant solar flare is heading their way. They must turn off all their electronics until the storm subsides.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: In the year 3021, on a space station somewhere between Mars and Jupiter in the Milky Way, 8-year-old Ella Ryder sets out with her friends on exciting adventures of discovery.

programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Knighty Knight Knight. Tom, Jerry and Tuffy have a run-in with a moving suit of armor. The knight scares Tom away, but Jerry makes a brave stand because he thinks the knight is Tom in disguise. Jerry eventually trips the suit of armor and finds out it's inhabited by three kittens. Relieved at first, the pets soon realize that battling one haunted knight is nothing compared to battling three real-life kittens.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Phan-Tom of the Oompah. In Catsylvania, the peasant mice oompah band plays onstage at the auditorium. As the bandleader's lovely daughter, Gretta, hits a high note in her rousing song, Tom—in a mask and hood—swings in on a rope and abducts her. Van Mouseling and the peasant band chase him through the rafters and backstage, but Tom escapes with his captive to a subterranean lair. Will the mice manage to free Gretta?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Ballad of the Catnip Kid. After Tom drifts off to sleep, a tumbleweed blows into his face, and he discovers that the kitchen looks like an old west saloon. The bartender, Spike, and customers recognize him as the Catnip Kid. Then he sees himself in the mirror—dressed like a gunslinger, a silver-plated pea shooter holstered to his hip! Will Sherriff Jerry bring him to justice in this western adventure?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Mirror Image. Skullie tells Tom that he won't have to sweat a visit from one of the spooks tonight. However, Tom is soon drawn to a full-length mirror that causes no shortage of trouble. As he gets pulled into the mirror, an evil reflection cat trades places with him. Tuffy and Jerry enter the mirror world too and must fight their reflection selves for survival.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show IV
programme.desc: Gym Rat. Overweight Jerry starts working out on a weight machine supplied to him by cousin Muscles. Not to be outdone, Tom starts lifting weights as well – which sets up an epic Battle Royale between the cat and mouse.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show IV
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show IV
programme.sub-title: Mice From Mars. Mice visitors from Mars force Tom to change the way he treats Jerry.
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Analog Ella. Ella and the gang are going camping! But as they approach their camp site, Maggie alerts them that a giant solar flare is heading their way. They must turn off all their electronics until the storm subsides.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: In the year 3021, on a space station somewhere between Mars and Jupiter in the Milky Way, 8-year-old Ella Ryder sets out with her friends on exciting adventures of discovery.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: The Cruise. Mr Bean wins two tickets for an exotic cruise and naturally he takes Teddy along for the trip of a lifetime. Once aboard the huge ocean liner Mr Bean soon settles into a life of luxury but while showing off to a new friend Bean becomes ‘man overboard’ and stranded on a dessert island. The hungrier he gets the wilder he becomes and desperate to find a way off the island.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Coconut Shy. Mr Bean goes to his favourite china shop to buy a new cup for Teddy but when he opens his wallet he doesn’t have enough money to pay for it. When he sees a poster for the local funfair where the stalls have cash prizes Bean is determined to win himself some money on the Coconut Shy. But after many unsuccessful attempts he realises it’s a fix and lets everyone know about it. Naturally this doesn’t go down well with the stallholder who wants revenge and a chase around the funfair ensues.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Green Bean. Mr Bean’s electricity supply is cut off when Mrs Wicket sees the cost of her enormous electricity bill. As the snow falls outside Mr Bean’s flat becomes so cold that there are ice cubes in his bath water. Mr Bean has the idea to build a huge wind turbine in the back garden providing his own power. All is going very well until an unexpected storm sends Bean’s wind turbine into overdrive creating a huge surge of electricity and a huge shock for everyone

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Cash Machine. Mr Bean goes to his local bakery to buy a cake but finds he doesn’t have any money. He goes to the bank to use the cash machine but he can’t remember his pin number. When Mr Bean's bankcard is swallowed up by the cash machine there’s only one thing to do - go into the machine and fetch it back. The police are alerted but Bean’s main concern is to get some money and get back to the baker’s before all the cakes are sold.

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Shorts XXV
programme.sub-title: Percy and the Skunks
programme.desc: Percy and the Skunks

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings II
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: The Day Star. It’s the Night of the Stars in Wonderland and Lewis invites Alice to see the show. Afterwards, our two friends make an unexpected encounter in the garden: they find a little star that’s eager to see daytime! Alice is only too happy to help it fulfill its dream. But when it starts gradually losing its star dust, they realize there’s a risk it might not be able to rise back into the sky to shine once again alongside its relatives. Alice and Lewis must prevent that danger from occurring, ASAP! And so off they head to the Valley of the Night!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Tooth the Rescue! When one of Lewis’ teeth falls out, no little tooth fairy comes to see him. Instead, the whole of Wonderland converges upon him! Basically, in this world, a loose tooth is an opportunity for making a wish, which makes it a very sought-after commodity among the Wonderlanders!! In the midst of all this squabbling, Alice must use cunning to help her good friend Lewis hold onto his precious tooth!

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Journey to the Moon. While delivering a yummy stew to the Queen, Alice and Lewis notice the moon is crying and that its falling tears are flooding the castle! Afraid her royal residence is about to collapse any minute, Queen orders Alice and Lewis to find a solution to this problem on the double! And so off they go to the moon, where a whole plethora of surprises awaits them.

programme.title: Alice & Lewis II
programme.desc: Seam Stress. Today, Queen has decided to commission a unique dress from her talented Seamstress Card: she wants it made out of wild thread – a very difficult one to tame! And should her Seamstress Card fail to pull it off, she will be relieved of her duties on the spot! Alice and Lewis jump to it, coming up with all kinds of bright ideas to help out the poor card. As a result, in the end, a whole cat walk of dresses awaits the Queen!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings II
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike Flu. Poor Mike is bedridden. He's been struck down by a nasty cold so Iris and the turtles are forced take care of his every need, including trying to repel the raccoons from the house. Fighting raccoons isn't their specialty and Iris and the turtles quickly end up locked in the garage. Mike is forced to intervene but he's so sick and weak that he's a pushover. How can he overcome the raccoons this time? Mike's problem could be the very solution he needs to defeat the tenacious raccoons.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: In The Doghouse. Mike is forced to spend the day outside in his doghouse due to Grandma Mikkelsen's fur allergy. Mike makes the best of being exiled and plans to spruce the place up and invite Iris over for an outdoor picnic. But Mercury has been kicked out of his lair after a fight with his brother and decides to squat in the doghouse. Mike does everything he can to wake up the snoozing raccoon and get him out of his home. It looks like he's going to have to bring in the big guns if has any chance of evicting his unwanted guest before Iris shows up.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The Ball. The nasty tennis player is big and angry and wants his ball back. The one Mr. Bean managed to throw on the roof of a house across the road. Paralysed with vertigo sixty feet up on a windowsill, he is eventually brought to earth by the helpful intervention of a neighbour’s pet gerbil.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Toothache. Bean’s sweet tooth leads him to despair when he bites off a bit more than he can chew. He is tormented by the toothache from Hell - and embarks on a hilarious mission to pull out this menace. Bean’s DIY attempts fail to succeed, and he is left with no other choice but to visit the dreaded dentist. But can Bean brave the Dentist’s chair? Or will the dentist despair when faced with Bean’s antics?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Haircut. After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper! The photographer arrives with the grateful lady cat owner, the scene is set, smiles all round…but then disaster strikes when Bean is continually upstaged by… his hair.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Neighbourly Bean. As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes
programme.desc: Baby Looney Tunes introduces the world's most beloved cartoon characters as precocious preschoolers, discovering the world one baby-step at a time!

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes
programme.sub-title: A Secret Tweet
programme.desc: Baby Looney Tunes introduces the world's most beloved cartoon characters as precocious preschoolers, discovering the world one baby-step at a time!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Metal Mess. Slippy needs iron to fix his spaceracer. Ella tows him to a metal asteroid where Glitch is instructed to cut off a small piece. But when Ella distracts him, he accidentally cuts the asteroid into two large pieces! Ella feels responsible

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: All in Good Time. Ella is excited to get her own room but Tilly is not as thrilled. She asks Slippy if he can make her a time machine to slow down time so tomorrow never comes. Slippy says the only place time shows down is around black holes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings III
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this "bear's privilege" except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The iconic cat and mouse rivals are back. The all-new series takes another look at the madcap slapstick and never-ending battle that has made Tom and Jerry two of the most beloved characters of all time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: One of a Kind. Tom and Jerry are hired by Polly the Dog get back her collar from park mean guy Barkley.They help put Barkley in the pound jail. He escapes but loses his memory after getting zapped by an electric fence. He clulessly hires Tom and Jerry to help him track down the detective duo that got him caught in the first place! Barkley reforms when he meets Polly and falls in love with her.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Belly Achin'. When Little Quacker finds that his favorite birdbath is cracked he enlists Jerry’s help to get it fixed. They get sidetracked by the scent of Tom’s delicious chinese takeout. After a battle for the food Tom steals Little Quacker’s fortune cookie and gets the best fortune ever! Tom sets out into the world with his newfound luck only to be on the receiving end of miserable luck.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show II
programme.desc: Slinging in the Rain. The storm of the century is brewing -- according to Tuffy and Jerry, that is, who are giving Tom a little payback for tormenting them earlier. Spike also gets caught up in the hysteria over the impending storm. When Spike uncovers the ruse, the mice must brace for their own storm.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Dog Daze. It's the hottest day ever and Spike is building a swimming pool for his son Tyke. When Tom and Jerry get kicked out of the house for being too destructive Spike enlists their help. Spike must do everything he can from losing his temper in front of Tyke when Tom and Jerry fail to do things the right way.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Keyboard Capers. Determined to master Beethoven’s symphony, Mr Bean wangles himself a grand piano, a music book, a candelabra and a very patient piano teacher. Liberace, eat your heart out!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A Running Battle. It's the start of a Fun Run. Mr. Bean lines-up beside his deadly enemy: the fat bloke who stole his parking space. Fun Run or no, nothing will stop Bean beating this man to the finishing post, even if he has to flag a cab.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Egg & Bean. Mr. Bean gets in a flap when a monster turns up in his cake-mix. The good news, though, is that the monster turns out to be a harmless baby bird. The bad news is that it grows into a huge stork and takes over his home. Bean attempts to return it to the wild, and finds teaching it to fly makes his arms ache.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Hopping Mad! When the frogspawn in Mr. Bean’s bath hatch out, it’s the last thing his landlady needs, especially when she’s invited the Mayor for tea. Hundreds of angry amphibians decide to invite themselves as well. Bean proves to be no expert at catching slippery green things that won’t stop hopping about all over the blinking place.

programme.title: Lu & The Bally Bunch - Shorts
programme.sub-title: Talking About Trying. The bugs talk about trying new things.
programme.desc: Lu is a little ladybird who has just started preschool with her new friends. Together they explore their brand new social lives through play, music, big feelings and even bigger fun.

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes
programme.sub-title: Cereal Boxing
programme.desc: Baby Looney Tunes introduces the world's most beloved cartoon characters as precocious preschoolers, discovering the world one baby-step at a time!

programme.title: Baby Looney Tunes
programme.sub-title: Who Said That?
programme.desc: Baby Looney Tunes introduces the world's most beloved cartoon characters as precocious preschoolers, discovering the world one baby-step at a time!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Super Tilly. Tilly is dressed as her alter-ego, SuperTilly – the greatest superhero in the universe! When her dad asks her if she can send him his toolbox, it’s SuperTilly to the rescue!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: White Dwarf, Blue Madhu. When Glitch's compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: No Contest. After entering Tyke in an agility contest, Spike sets up a course for the puppy in the backyard. Soon, Spike decides the course isn't hard enough and gets Tom to help, bending Tom into pretzel-like positions for Tyke to leap over, through, or into. After all this preparation, Tyke must still make it to the competition on time.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Calorie Count. Jerry's high-born cousin Count DaCalories—a haughty city mouse—visits the estate. At first, he acts sleek and refined, but soon he can't resist pigging out and going on multiple kitchen raids. As his paunch grows, it becomes more and more difficult for him to outrun Tom and stay out of sight of the Duchess's visitor.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Fortune Hunters. When Stinker, the trash-loving dog, comes by looking for help, Tom and Jerry aren't inclined to take the case until they hear it involves a missing fortune. So, they're disappointed when they find out Stinker is searching for a lost fortune cookie from his Chinese takeout to learn his fate. Retracing the dog's steps, they chase the fortune cookie's trail through town.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Game Changer. As Jerry and Tuffy play marbles, Tom throws a soccer ball in their direction and upsets the game. This sparks a chase between Tom and Jerry, and Jerry takes cover in a room that looks like a giant chessboard. As more chess pieces show up, Tom and Jerry attempt their best to outplay them.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Kiss and Makeup. Tom is chasing the mice around the haunted house when midnight strikes, and he finds himself face-to-face with a green-faced beast who's just as surprised to encounter Tom. It's soon revealed to be Toodles, who's a good witch brewing magic beauty products. Although Tom is enchanted at first, things stop going smoothly when he helps with her potions.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Suitable for Framing. A ghost paints a flattering portrait of Tom, but Tom is stingy with his payment and the ghost casts a spell on the portrait. Strange things start happening as the portrait absorbs injuries and calories that should be affecting Tom. However, soon Jerry and Tuffy figure out what's going on and use it to their advantage.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show III
programme.desc: Springtime for Spike. When Rick and Ginger are asked to dog-sit for a friend's French poodle, Sabrina, Tom is initially on his guard, but soon he's practically eating out of her hand. Next, Spike falls for Sabrina and does everything he can to impress her with how kind he is to Tom. How long will everyone's behavior be affected by Sabrina's presence?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Super Tilly. Tilly is dressed as her alter-ego, SuperTilly – the greatest superhero in the universe! When her dad asks her if she can send him his toolbox, it’s SuperTilly to the rescue!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: White Dwarf, Blue Madhu. When Glitch's compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Bear Under Lock And Key. Unwilling to share the food both he and the Lemmings are wild
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean in Love. He’s got her record, the poster and the T-shirt, so when Mr. Bean’s heart-throb, Roxy, is set to sing in concert at the London Palladium, he sets his sights on the only thing that will make his life complete: her signature in his autograph book. A difficult feat but can love prevail?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Double Trouble. Mr. Bean is over the moon when he meets Mr. Pod because both men have so much in common; same shirt, jacket, trousers and underpants. And to top it all, Pod is Bean’s spitting image! Bean falls to Earth with a bump, though, when his girlfriend, Irma Gobb, finds Mr. Pod much better looking than him.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Home Movie. Mr Bean is unimpressed with a horror movie he sees at the cinema and reckons he can do much better. Bean sets out to create his very own home movie masterpiece –featuring Mrs Wicket Irma and Teddy! The screening in the garden is a huge success but will Mrs Wicket be pleased with her makeover and starring role?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series II
programme.desc: Fish Sitting. Mr Bean has to look after Mrs Wicket’s pet goldfish while she is away. With a ravenous Scrapper sniffing around Bean ends up becoming more bodyguard than babysitter. But when he manages to lose his fishy friend Mr Bean takes a nightmare journey down the sewer and back to his neighbour’s house via the park. Can Mr Bean get the pesky pet back in the bowl before Mrs Wicket returns home?

programme.title: Thomas & Friends - Shorts XXV
programme.sub-title: Kana and the Butterflies
programme.desc: Kana and the Butterflies

programme.title: Alice & Lewis
programme.desc: Six-year-old Alice has a magical key that leads her to Wonderland. In this “other realm”, she’s met an endearing rabbit, Lewis, and the two have become fast friends – best friends to be exact! Alice loves going to Wonderland and teaming up with Lewis and her other friends, even if it means contending with the whimsical, hot-headed Queen. Each episode entails a visit to Wonderland, where Alice experiences a wacky adventure with Lewis, confronting the crazy, eccentric rules and conventions that reign supreme in this parallel Kingdom. Alice’s adventures always begin in the “real world” where she is faced with a particular situation. Her far-fetched experiences in Wonderland lead her to a positive outcome or gain insight which helps her to resolve this dilemma and thus, at the end of each episode, she returns happily to the real world.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike, a refined pug with sophisticated tastes, longs for a quiet life but is instead forced to defend his house from a bunch of furry intruders. Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Electric Turtles. The turtles are struck by lightning during a storm, turning them into positively charged projectiles zapping everything they touch and setting off all the appliances in the house. Mike gets locked outside by the raccoons who were freezing their little butts off in their lair. By the time Mike gets back inside all hell has broken loose, but Mike might have figured out how he can get rid of the raccoons and de-electrify the turtles at the same time.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Rescuing Roxanne. Playing with Louise and her doll gives Mike an idea. He decides to stage a rescue mission with the doll from the roof of the Mikkelson's house so he can be a hero and impress Iris. But as he prepares to show Iris that he's a real-life superhero, the racoons arrive and ruin his plans. Mercury falls in love with the doll the minute he lays eyes on it while Freddy sets his sights on her sparkly tiara. Now Mike has a real rescue on his hands, all under Iris's watchful gaze. The stakes couldn't be higher!

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: A Sick Trick. The racoons watch Mike enviously as he makes himself comfortable in his living room. If only they could get a piece of that sweet action. Then Freddy has an idea. He crashes into the bay window and pretends to be injured, forcing the Mikkelsens to take him in. Mike sees through the ruse immediately, but if he's going to unmask the scheming raccoon he's going to have to defeat the imposter without getting himself in trouble for fighting the poor "injured" Freddy.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

Raccoons, turtles and Fluffy the Cat have a knack for showing up at the worst possible moments, dragging Mike into a series of unforeseen twists and turns! After his owners return, an exhausted Mike finds himself in the dog house once again, missing yet another opportunity to impress Cindy, the neighbor's elegant dog.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Hoverboard. Mike is impressed with Tom's hoverboard tricks and decides to try to master them to impress Iris. As soon as Tom steps out, Mike tries to get his hands on the board but the turtles have other ideas. In fact, everyone seems to want a turn on the hoverboard, including the raccoons. It's the perfect way for them to get their loot from the house to their den. Mike is going to have to step up if he wants to defeat the raccoons and get Tom's hoverboard back.

programme.title: CoComelon
programme.desc: Welcome CoComelon! In CoComelon, Baby JJ and his family go on fun every-day experiences packed with things to learn and explore. There is always something new to learn in these everyday situations which any pre-schooler can relate to!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In a vast natural reserve lost in the middle of the untamed wilderness, there is a small haven of human civilization: the forest ranger's house. Because he is (from his point of view) the most evolved animal on earth, the bear Grizzy feels it's only natural that the ranger's house becomes his territory as soon as its owner is away. No other animal dares to contest this 'bear's privilege,' except the most inoffensive, stupid and ridiculous mammal family that exists: the Lemmings - who also move into the house as soon as the ranger is gone. Grizzy and the Lemmings lead a merciless battle over the house in an atmosphere of total madness, where the two adversaries constantly try to outdo each other with nasty tricks!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: At ACME Construction Company, Bugs Bunny and Lola Bunny manage a crew of builders that, quite frankly, should not be anywhere near a construction site. However, by working together as a team, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Tweety and others use their tools and wild vehicles to pull off some of the looniest construction jobs ever.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs Bunny Builders is a fun and exciting preschool series featuring your favorite Looney Tunes working at a construction company. Join Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig and Tweety Bird as they use their amazing vehicles to take on the looniest builds ever. Along the way, they’ll learn valuable lessons and never give up because The Looney Builders always get the job done!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes. Having just been created by the Batcomputer, our heroes are essentially kids with little to no life experience. Led by Bam (The Batmobile), the Batwheels - Bibi (The Batgirl Cycle), Red (The Redbird), Jett (The Batwing) and Buff (The Bat Truck) - must navigate the growing pains of being a newly formed super team as well as the growing pains that come with just being a kid.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Royal Bean. When Mr. Bean breaks his favourite Royal mug he discovers there's only one place to buy a replacement: Buckingham Palace, home of the Queen of England. When one of Her Majesty's corgis runs off with his teddy, Bean gives chase through secret tunnels… and gets lost.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Young Bean. When did Mr. Bean first meet his teddy bear? Did he really learn to drive his mini at the age of ten? Could he possibly have known his battle-axe of a landlady when she was a sweet and blushing bride? Bean takes us on a journey into the past, answering these questions and giving us an inkling as to what made him the man he is today.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In the pink. Mr. Bean finds himself lumbered with an unwanted pet in the form of a four-legged ball of pink fur with piggy eyes and a penchant for earthworms. Encyclopedias leave him none the wiser as to the identity of the pesky creature but Bean can’t bring himself to just abandon it. The puzzle is eventually solved after a picnic in the park and a raid on the local pet shop.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Dinner for two. Mr. Bean forgets the golden rule: never fall asleep in the bath when you've got a chicken in the oven. So what romantic meal can he quickly rustle-up for his luckless girlfriend, Irma Gobb? The cheese from the mousetrap? The flower from the vase? A meal is eventually provided by an uninvited guest.

programme.title: Meet the Batwheels
programme.desc: Batwheels, a preschool animated action-adventure comedy series starring the most heroic and iconic vehicles from the DC universe. They are a team of incredible crimefighters who have banded together to oppose evil, combat crime and clean up the streets of Gotham City. They are...okay, they're NOT Batman and Robin. They're the Batwheels - an awesome group of sentient super-powered crime-fighting vehicles defending Gotham City alongside Batman, Robin, Batgirl and a host of DC Super Heroes.

programme.title: Moley
programme.desc: Moley is a lively animated comedy series for children and families of all ages. It follows the underground adventures of a charmingly optimistic young mole, Moley. As the keeper of The Mystical Manual of Magic — known more affectionately as “Manny,” Moley is forever embarking on comedic, zany, Moletastic and thrilling magical adventures which are filled with heart, to help the citizens of the bustling city of MoleTown. What Moley lacks in physical prowess and smarts, he makes up for in heart and friendship! So, with his friends Dotty, a plucky, adventure-seeking mole, Mishmosh, an oddball inventor mole, Mona Lisa, the sensible grounded Mole and Mystic Mole, a wise old mole who knows more than he lets on - there’s no challenge Moley can’t mishandle-- but then soon overcome!

programme.title: Moley

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Failed Star. Ella finds her Nanny's old Hide and Peek device and hopes to beat Slippy's record for Hide and Seek! Gem and I.Lo are playing too. Slippy decides to make things more interesting by siphoning fuel from the Hide and Peek.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Starquake! The Ryder family completes a drill in the event of a Starquake. Shields are deployed around Home and Dad's museum on the moon. The drill is a success but the shield on the moon is stuck open.
